item.name: Swan's Song Bracer
entries: If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points while wearing this bracer, you can use your reaction to trap their soul inside of the bracer. If the creature is unwilling it must succeed on a DC15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save its soul departs as normal.
If the bracer already contains a soul or the target is wearing any items or enchantments meant to trap or redirect the soul after death, such as a Ring of Mind Shielding, the bracer fails.

While you are wearing the bracer and it has a soul inside it, you use an action to take on the appearance of the person the soul belongs to as if with the {@spell Alter Self} spell, for a maximum duration of 8 hours or until you take off the bracer. This property of the bracer can't be used again until the next dawn.

A creature trapped in the bracer is aware of the passage of time and retains its full personality and memory. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet and can communicate telepathically with anyone wearing the bracer.

Once per day, you can attempt to force the soul to answer a question. When you do this you must succeed on a Wisdom check contested by the soul's Charisma check. If you win the soul must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. If the soul wins you are {@condition Charmed} by the soul for {@dice 1d12} hours. While {@condition Charmed}, you must try to follow the soul's commands. If you take damage, you can repeat the contested checks, ending the effect on a success. While you are {@condition Charmed} by the soul it can choose to depart the bracer.
A creature can not be revived while their soul is trapped inside the bracer. You can release the soul as a bonus action. If the bracer is destroyed the soul is released automatically.
A silver bracer, richly decorated with topaz inlays and golden ornamentation.

entries.name: Credits

item.name: Fall's Fervour
entries: While you are wielding Fall's Fervour, the handle grows to wrap around your hand and can only be removed by you. A different creature attempting to remove the axe needs to succeed on a DC20 Strength check in order to break the grip of the handle.

You can use a bonus action to speak this magic axe's command word, creating a flurry of razor-sharp leaves that start whirling around the axe. While the Leaves are swirling around the axe, it deals an extra {@dice 1d8} slashing damage to any target it hits.

While the flurry is around the Axe you can use an Action to move it to an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet of you. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the Flurry must make a DC15 Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can cause the Flurry to return to the Axe as a Bonus Action.
Once the tool of a woodcutter lost to time, the roots of a dead tree now wrap around this broken-off axe head, forming a crude handle.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Flitfang
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Any time you make a melee attack with advantage that bonus increases to +5.
Immediately after making a ranged attack, the weapon teleports back to your hand. If you don't have a hand free, the weapon teleports to a spot at your feet.

entries.name: Feral Flurry
entries: When you hit with an attack on a hostile creature using this dagger, you can choose to roll a second attack against a different creature within 60 ft. of the original dagger as if you attacked them with the dagger. The second attack counts as a sneak attack. This property of the dagger can't be used again until you finish a Short Rest.

entries.name: Blood Moon
entries: While holding this dagger you can draw some of your own blood with it as an action, taking {@dice 1d4+2} points of slashing damage. Doing this will cause the dagger to transform into a large red wolf with a metallic sheen to its fur ({@creature Flitfang|ToT}). The wolf remains for 1 hour or until it drops to 0 Hit Points. While you are touching the wolf ({@creature Flitfang|ToT}) you can will it to transform back into the dagger as an action. Roll initiative for the Wolf, which has its own turns.
The Wolf ({@creature Flitfang|ToT}) has the personality and mental statistics of the Dagger. This property can't be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Flitfang is a sentient weapon of lawful neutral alignment, with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 17, and a Charisma of 14. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.

The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and any creatures within 60 feet of it that it trusts. It can speak Common. It can also speak with wolves as if using a {@spell Speak With Animals} spell, using telepathy to involve its wielder in the conversation.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Flitfang is slow to trust non-beasts and will growl telepathically to its wielder if they perceive a creature as being particularly untrustworthy.

When handed to a new user it tends to keep its sentience hidden, waiting to see how their new wielder uses them first, revealing its nature only if they think the ideals of the wielder align with its own, after which it is intensely loyal.
It views its main purpose as keeping its wielder and the party alive, to which it refers to as its â€˜pack'.

Flitfang is opposed to the unnecessary killing of creatures and values loyalty and discipline above all. Conflict arises if its wielder causes unnecessary harm or betrays its allies without good reason.
The grip of this double-edged dagger has been wrapped in red wolf's hide.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Wetstone
entries: Using an Action, you can put this stone in a liquid, causing it to absorb that liquid at a rate of 12 gallons per minute. The stone can hold up to 36 gallons of liquid.

As long as the stone holds any amount of liquid, as an action, you can squeeze the stone, causing the liquid to pour from the stone, up to 2 gallons per minute. It appears to emerge from the mouth of the painted face.
If the stone absorbs a liquid while already containing a liquid of a different type, they interact as normal.
Any effects the interaction of the different substances produces occur when the liquids are poured out of the stone.
Whenever the stone contains at least 1 gallon of an alcoholic beverage, it starts rolling in a random direction if put on a flat surface.
A smooth river stone with a laughing face painted on it.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Wren's Staff of Wanderlust
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls.

The staff has 10 Charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended Charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its Charges to cast one of the following Spells from it: {@spell Goodberry} (1 charge), {@spell Longstrider} (1 charge), {@spell Water Walk} (3 charges), {@spell Freedom of movement} (4 charges) or {@spell Find the Path} (charges 7).

entries.name: Evening-rest And Sleep to Meet
entries: While you are attuned to this staff, the time needed to take a long rest is halved for you.

entries.name: Where Many Paths And Errands Meet
entries: While holding the staff you can use an action to expend 3 charges to learn the number of humanoids that passed within 60 feet of your current location in the last 24 hours. Additionally, you know what races were among them, but not how many.

entries.name: Now Far Ahead The Road Has Gone
entries: While on a road or path you can spend 1 minute concentrating on one direction of the road and expend 5 charges to gain knowledge of where it leads in that direction for the next 7 miles or until it ends. You learn the shape of the road as well as any changes in elevation. Additionally, you become aware of any noteworthy sites within 60 feet of the road, such as buildings or bodies of water. If the road diverges into multiple paths, such as in the case of a crossroads, you can choose which is considered the continuation of the road for the purpose of this property.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The staff is a sentient chaotic good staff with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 16 and a Charisma of 12. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The staff communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Druidic, Elvish, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Personality
entries: When traveling the staff has a habit of humming travel songs and occasionally comments on noteworthy locations or sights.

The staff has been imbued with the curiosity and wanderlust of the Treant it grew out off and all those that have wielded it since. It seeks to see and learn as much of the world as possible. Conflict arises if it feels it is kept in one place for too long.
When shown any particularly interesting or unique locations the staff might choose to reward its wielder by sharing stories and secrets about places it has been or those it traveled with.
The staff has no name, but happily takes on any name it is given.
Created out of the branch of a curious Treant, this staff is inset with a crystal at its top. Usually hung from it are trinkets and oddments found throughout the travels of those who wielded it.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Eye of the Cloven Sage
entries: While wearing this eyepatch you can see through the eye at its front as if it were your own.

The eyepatch has 10 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell True Seeing} (6 charges), {@spell Detect Magic} (1 charge), or {@spell Arcane Eye} (4 charges).

entries.name: Dark One's Gaze
entries: As an Action you can expend one charge to target a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a DC15 Wisdom Saving throw or be forced to look into the eye and be paralyzed. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends if the target can no longer see into the eye at the end of your turn or you end the effect as a bonus action. While this property is active it expends one charge at the beginning of each turn.
The eyepatch regains {@dice 1d6+4} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The eyepatch is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the eyepatch, wearing it at all times. Being in possession of the eye over time subjects you to hallucinations. To begin with, the hallucinations are mild things - glimpses of odd colors, movement out of the corner of their eye. After a long enough time, the hallucinations are sentient beings that communicate with the wearer - but are only visible when looking through the eyepatch.
A brass eyepatch inset with an obsidian eye. It blinks in accordance with the wearer.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Sleet Stave
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The staff consists of 5 segments. When you hit with an attack using this magic quarterstaff you can choose to let a segment on the end of the staff shatter, dealing an additional {@dice 3d6} piercing damage.
When the staff is reduced to 3 segments or less, it counts as a club.
As long as there is at least 1 segment of the staff remaining, it regains 1 new segment every 8 hours, growing it out of moisture in the air.
If you shatter the last remaining segment of the quarterstaff it is destroyed.
Grown into the shape of a staff, this icicle only melts in the hottest fires. It is cold to the touch to anyone not attuned to it.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Locket of the Lost
entries: The locket fits a piece of paper or a small, flat object of up to 1 inch in diameter.
The Locket can only be assigned to a single creature at any given time. Spending an additional 10 minutes concentrating you can assign the locket to a new creature.

If you die while attuned to the locket, it lets out a mournful wail and it and its contents disappear in a wisp of smoke,  reappearing in the nearest unoccupied space to the creature it is currently assigned to.

In the case that you are attuned to the locket but have not assigned it to a creature or the creature is dead, it fails to disappear. The Locket can travel across any distance and even to Other Planes of existence.
After the locket is used in this way, it becomes non-magical for a year and a day.
A plain iron locket adorned with engravings of wailing Banshees.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Twinkle Doll
entries: While touching the doll, you can use an action to possess it. Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the doll. While possessed, the doll takes the statistics of {@creature Possessed Twinkle Doll|ToT}.

You retain your Alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma scores. In combat, the doll moves on your turn. The Doll can not speak.You can vacate the doll, returning to your own body, as a reaction. If your body is dead when you attempt to return to it, you die.
When you vacate the doll or it drops to 0 hit points while possessed, it ignites, casting the fireball spell (save DC 13) centered on it.
If the doll ignites as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, your soul is forcefully expelled from it back into your body and you take {@dice 3d8} psychic damage.
An old, straw-filled ragdoll with a patch above its heart. It is always comfortably warm to the touch.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Gloves of Opalescence
entries: These gloves allow you to create an extradimensional space centered on a solid surface for 1 hour.

The gloves have 4 charges. Using an action to expend one charge, you can touch a flat surface of 5 by 5 feet. The surface gives off an opalescent shimmer and allows creatures or objects to pass through it into the extradimensional space for the full duration. The space can fit up to one medium or small creature.
While active, the entrance to the space can be detected by succeeding on a DC15 Wisdom (Perception) check.

Attacks and Spells can cross through the entrance into or out of the extradimensional space, and, while inside the surface, events outside of it appear blurred and distorted. Any Wisdom (Perception) checks made to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. Creatures inside of the space remain aware of the passage of time and can cast Spells on themselves while inside. They can use their Movement to leave the surface where they entered it. They otherwise can't move.
The entrance to the space is bound to the surface it was assigned to and moves in accordance with it.

If the surface is destroyed to the extent that it can no longer hold the entrance or the duration ends, any creatures or objects still inside are expelled into an unoccupied space closest to the entrance of the extradimensional space.
The gloves regain {@dice 1d3+1} expended Charges daily at dawn.
A pair of long gloves adorned with an opalescent orb on the back of each hand.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Wavering Wonder Ink
entries: After making a marking of any kind with this ink the writer can speak a command word of their choosing, causing the ink to disappear. Once the ink has dried, speaking the command word over it will cause it to re-appear. Repeating the command word returns the ink to its invisible state. Writing over it with regular ink causes that ink to be replaced by the Wonder Ink for the duration the Wonder Ink is visible.
One inkwell contains enough to cover either 10 pages or 8 square feet of skin, wood, stone or other materials. The ink is suitable for tattooing.
The ink can be sensed by Detect Magic. Casting Dispel Magic on the ink will cause it to become visible.
This dark green ink appears to contain small glittering motes and gives off a faint odorless smoke when wet.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Fading Lily
entries: When a person attunes themselves to this item, they impart on it a magical imprint of their very being and the flower changes to a color and scent that reflects this.

Once attuned, this item can be gifted to another sentient creature. When willingly accepted, the creature will immediately forget all memories of the attuned character without realizing what has happened. They are unaware of any holes, inconsistencies, and contradictions in their memory that result from this, but can realize them when pointed out.
After being gifted, the attunement to the Lily fades and the flower loses its magic.
Removed memories can be restored using a wish spell or if the receiver willingly gifts the Lily back to the giver.
A fragile looking flower found in forgotten places. Its pale colored petals are almost transparent and droop down to its slender stalk.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Blinkback Boots
entries: While wearing these boots you can spend a bonus action to designate a 5 ft. square area you are standing on as the blinkback spot. The spot is marked by two faintly glowing, hard to see footprints (DC15 Perception) and remains until it is used or until you designate a new blinkback spot.

The boots have 4 Charges. As long as you are within 500 feet of the blinkback spot you can use an action to click the boots' heels together and expend a charge, which causes the wearer to be teleported to the blinkback spot. You can bring along Objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry.

If the blinkback spot is already occupied by a creature or object, you teleport to the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). The blinkback spot is bound to the surface it was assigned to and moves in accordance with it.
The boots regain {@dice 1d4} expended Charges once you finish a long rest.
Made out of fine leather, these sturdy boots have metal soles that give off a soft glow.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Knocker of Aberrant Passage
entries: This Door Knocker allows you to call on powers from the far realm to create a shortcut between two points on the same plane of existence.

While attuned to this item you can use an action to press it against a flat surface and knock 3 times, naming a location you are familiar with on the same plane of existence. On the 3rd knock the knocker attaches itself to the surface and tentacles start to emerge from it, growing into a doorway. The door takes 1 minute to fully form and can not be opened before that. An identical doorway grows on a randomly determined surface near the location you named. The door has a size of 6 by 3 feet.

The door opens into an organic hallway that stretches for 60 ft. and ends in the exit door. Any creature that enters the hallway is exposed to eldritch forces and must make a DC14 Wisdom saving throw. A target takes {@dice 8d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Warlocks of the Great Old One remain unaffected.

The hallway remains for 1 minute, after which both doors, including the knocker, crumble into dust and any creatures that are still inside are expelled out of a randomly determined door. The knocker reappears near the creature it is attuned to after {@dice 1d8} hours.
An old copper door knocker fashioned to resemble the face of an eldritch creature. It is always cold to the touch.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Ring of Infinite Seals
entries: While wearing this ring you can use a bonus action to press your finger against it and cause the top surface to shift into an engraved version of a symbol you are familiar with.
The symbol remains until you change it to a new one or remove it. If subjected to effects that cancel magic, such as dispel magic or an antimagic field, the ring it returns to it empty state.
A plain brass ring adorned with a flat, empty surface at its top.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Battlebutter
entries: As a bonus action you can use the butter to grease the bottoms of your feet.
While your feet are greased in this way your walking speed is doubled for the next movement you make. This does not work on rough terrain.

If on your turn you do not move up to your full movement or do not move in a straight line, you must make a DC15 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save you continue your movement as normal. On a failed save you keep sliding in the direction you were originally heading for the duration of your movement.
If as a result of this you collide with a solid object or creature you take {@dice 1d4} damage per 10 feet of movement taken up until the point of collision.
The stick of butter can be used 3 times in this way before it is used up. If not utilized in this manner the butter acts as regular butter.
This stick of wonderfully golden butter has been adorned with glowing arcane symbols on two sides.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Gambler's Gold
entries: When making an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you can choose to flip the coin in place of rolling. The Crow will mean it automatically counts as a natural 1, while the Swan will make it a natural 20. This outcome can not be affected by abilities meant to change the result of a roll, such as 'Lucky' or 'Inspiration'.
You can't use the coin in this manner again for 7 days. If the result is in any way tampered with, magical or otherwise, the ability fails and is wasted.
This golden coin fits in the palm of your hand and does not resemble any existing currency. One side features the image of a Crow, while the other has that of a Swan.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Cantrip Candle
entries: The candle's magic is activated when the candle is lit, which requires an action. After burning for 1 hour, the candle is destroyed. You can snuff it out early for use at a later time. Deduct the time it burned in increments of 1 minute from the candle's total burn time. While lit, the candle sheds dim light in a color of the DMs choice in a 30-foot radius.

The candle is associated with a cantrip from the sorcerer spell list. Characters within 30 feet of the candle who are able to smell the scent it emits gain the ability to cast the cantrip associated with the candle for the duration. Characters who are already able to cast the cantrip gain no benefit from smelling the scent. If a character leaves the radius of the scent they lose the ability to cast the cantrip.
Your spellcasting ability when casting spells with the help of the candle is charisma.
When casting a spell with the help of the candle there is a {@chance 10|10%} chance of triggering a wild magic surge.
A scented candle, of a shape and color of the DM's choosing, which, when lit, exudes a strange smell that reminds of far off places.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Lorelei's Pride
entries: You can use a Bonus action to swallow this pearl, causing your singing voice to become magical. For the next minute you can use an Action to start singing. You must take a Bonus Action on each subsequent turn to continue the song, for a full duration of 1 minute, after which the song ends and the pearl is destroyed.

Every creature within 120 ft. of you that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Charmed} until the song ends. The song ends if you are incapacitated. If the song ends before the full duration is up you can spend another Action to restart it for its remaining duration.

While under the influence of the song's charm, a target is {@condition Incapacitated}. If the {@condition Charmed} target is more than 5 ft. away from you, it must spend its turn moving towards you by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid Opportunity Attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to the song for the rest of its duration.
Found at the bottom of seas where ships fear to sail, this pearl shimmers with a murky light.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: Envelope of Expeditious Delivery
entries: You can use an Action to put a letter or small object that weighs up to 3 ounces inside this envelope and write the name of a person with whom you are familiar with on the front. After the name is written the envelope will teleport to the closest unoccupied space to the person for whom it is intended. The envelope can distinguish between two individuals with the same name and understands the sender's intent.
Once the receiver opens the letter, the name fades from the front of the envelope and it can't be used in this manner until the next dawn.

If the weight exceeds 3 ounces, the envelope is unable to properly shut or the receiver on a different plane of existence than the sender, the name automatically fades and the teleportation is wasted.
A worn envelope of 5 by 10 inches made out of aged paper.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

item.name: The Eye of the Dao
entries: On rare occasions, when the primordial matter of an elemental plane collides and merges with the soul of a living creature, it can create a genie. Rumour now tells of an item hidden deep within the elemental plane of earth. An orb of pure, condensed primordial matter of the elemental plane of earth, which could transform a creature into a {@creature Dao}. Said to be guarded vigorously, the Eye of the Dao is to be given by the Dao to one they consider worthy of ascending to genie-kind.

To attune to the eye you must be reduced to 0 Hit Points while on the elemental plane of earth. If a creature casts {@spell Reincarnate} on you while you are holding the eye, it merges with you. Your reincarnated body resembles your previous body, with the Eye of the Dao appearing in the form of a third eye on your forehead. You recall your former life and experiences and retain the capabilities and Racial traits you had in your original form. However for the purpose of spells such as {@spell Locate Creature} you are considered a Dao and are native to the elemental plane of earth. Once attuned, the attunement to the eye can not be broken.
If a creature knows your true name you may be called forth by rituals intended to summon a Genie.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The Eye of the Dao has the following properties, determined by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide:

items: 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial property}
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental properties}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental property}

entries.name: True Form
entries: You can use an action to transform into a {@creature Dao} as if with the {@spell True Polymorph} spell (no concentration required). You retain your mental Ability Scores and can transform back as an action. The Dao resembles your regular form in its facial features and build. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Noble Calling
entries: The eye has 3 charges. You can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast the {@spell Wish} spell from it. When doing so you may only use the spell to grant the wish of a different creature. You may determine the nature of the outcome of the wish as long as it adheres to the creature's precise wording. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. The eye loses this property if it has no Charges. The eye regains 1 charge for every year you spend on the elemental plane of earth.

entries.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If you die, your body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment you were wearing. Upon your death, the eye disappears and is deposited in a random location on the elemental plane of earth.

entries.name: Destroying the Eye
entries: If the eye is kept away from the elemental plane of earth for a year and a day without being attuned to a creature it crumbles into dust, conjuring an {@creature Earth Elemental} in the place it was destroyed. The Earth Elemental is hostile towards all creatures not native to the elemental plane of earth.
A green, crystalline orb usually found only at the heart of the elemental plane of earth. When not attuned, the orb is enveloped by a layer of rock.

entries.name: Credits
entries: This item is part of the 'Tavern of Trinkets', a growing collection of illustrated Magic Items created by Jelke Ludolphij. For more items and access to exclusive extra's, support me on {@link Patreon|https://www.patreon.com/trinkets}!

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The flitfang has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The flitfang has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the flitfang's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated} .

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: Flitfang makes two attacks: one with his bite and one with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Teleport {@recharge 4}
entries: Flitfang magically teleports, along with any Equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space of its choice next to ally it can see within 60 ft. Before or after teleporting, Flitfang can make one bite or claw Attack.

reaction.name: Vacate
entries: Your soul leaves the doll, causing it to enable Explosive Package.

trait.name: Explosive Package
entries: When you use the Vacate reaction, or the Possessed Twinkle Doll drops to 0 hit points, it ignites, casting the {@spell Fireball} spell (save {@dc 13}) centered on it.
If the doll ignites as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, the user possessing it takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.
